name: California Poppy
overview: The poppies will bloom in spring and early summer and then dies down during the summer. Its flower only opens on sunny days. Blooms from February to September. They are endangered.
habitat: Native to the Pacific slope of North America from Western Oregon to Baja California.  The seed were introduced into English garden in the 19th century. It is seen alone roadsides, empty lots and other places. Some poppies are wild but some are not (hard to distinguish nowadays).
